item.description:
This Event is Sold Out!

From The Great Fenway Park Writers Series:

This is a Thursday night, April 19 dinner in the Esplanade Room of the Hotel Commonwealth at 6:30 pm on the eve of Fenway Parks 100th Anniversary. The Red Sox have planned a series of open house events on April 19th at the ballpark, with this dinner capping the day. 

Among those sharing their memories and experiences of Fenway on the 19th are Mike Dukakis, Tom Werner, Peter Gammons, Dr. Charles Ogletree, Ed Markey, Dick Flavin, and Third Generation Season Ticket Holder, Donna Eden Cohen.

It will be an evening of of memories and laughter, of summers past and to come, of winters of discontent and winters of joy (2004 and 2007), and though it all we will explore the extraordinary hold Fenway Park and the Red Sox have on the people of Boston, the Commonwealth of MA, of New England and Red Sox Nation. And, at the evening's end, we will lift our glasses and toast America's Most Beloved Ballpark.

Dinner cost is $55.00 Reservations may only be made through Ms. Katie Rippin at the Hotel Commonwealth. E Mail krippin@hotelcommonwealth.com or call 617-532-5017.

More info at www.fenwaypark writers.org.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet by 6:15pm in lobby This event needs an Event Host
item.name: The Great Fenway Park Writers Series - Fenway Park In My Life Dinner & Program
